Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Different transitions not working as aspected, only root transition gets applied" (#7643) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/4kf9egr3/](https://jsfiddle.net/4kf9egr3/)

### Steps to reproduce
Create a transition inside a transition with different effects.

### What is expected?
Two different effects should be shown.

### What is actually happening?
Only the effect of the root transition is shown.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "width without px/cm/... in style binding should give a warning in dev. mode" (#7642) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I had this really bad brainfart today where I was trying to figure out why my elements weren't updating their width correctly. I eventually found out that I was missing the "px" in my bindings and everything was fine again.

Imo, It would be helpful to warn the author (at least in development mode) that the binding is just a pure number which might not be what the developer intended.

This could also be used for other properties like height, paddings and margins.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Not an API, just a warning: "The width/height/... is a pure number, maybe you're missing 'px' for example?"

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix for #1862" (#2060) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
As I am also relying on having dynamically added routes and a fallback 404 route, I tried fixing #1862 by checking not only if the matched routes length changed but also if the matched route itself changed:
`route.matched[0] === current.matched[0]`

Is this a valid way to fix this issue? Or do we have to check if there is more than one matched route?
